title: Norwich Man Accused in Accidental Shooting Death Arrested
content:
A Norwich man has been arrested for an accidental shooting that killed a woman earlier this month.
Police found 19-year-old Roxanne Shipman with a gunshot wound at a Division Street home back on December 1. She later died at the hospital.
Wednesday police arrested 25-year-old James Maricle. Investigators say he negligently fired the rifle that killed Shipman.
Maricle is charged with criminally negligent homicide. He also faces a criminal contempt charge for violating an order of protection from an unrelated case.
Police say that order prohibits Maricle from possessing or buying firearms.
